intro: Luzuriaga latifolia var. uniflora, commonly known as the broadleaf luzuriaga, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale blue, bloom in late spring or early summer. Luzuriaga latifolia var. uniflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
